It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The leaves are densely covered with fine, soft hairs, giving the plant its "puberulus" designation, meaning "hairy" in Latin. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
